title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding to establish a Working Group for the promotion of smooth bilateral trade between Sri Lanka and China
decision_details: - It has been proposed to establish a working group to promote smooth bilateral trade between Sri Lanka and China. This aims to unlock the untapped potential of bilateral trade, address trade-related challenges and enhance the volume and quality of trade between Sri Lanka and China. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Co-operative Development to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China and the Ministry of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Co-operative Development of Sri Lanka to establish the working group as proposed, was approved by the Cabinet.
